Author: hastrup#8742
Content: @Don King what is the difference between btc core and btc legacy he/she keeps taking about core will fail and legacy will survive or am I missing something?

Author: tolken#2655
Content: @hastrup figured he was referring to bitcoin cash

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: he is talking about BTC before segwit and after

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: segwit addresses that start with 3 are encoded in the blockchain as an anyonecan spend output

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that sounds as bad as it is as anybody could spend. the only thing stopping it is the miners are all running a soft fork and interpret signature data that is separated out

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as more and more funds accumulate in the anyone can spend addresses, the temptation to do exactly that will increase. there is no need to go back to when segwit activated, the miners can do this at anytime.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course it will create a chain split  but if the vast majority of mining hashrate is mining the pre-segwit bitcoin, there wont be any space in the segwit bitcoin to process the transactions, especially as its blocktime increases.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there will likely be a large battle around this and we will most likely end up with two chains, the current chain with segwit addresses intact and the non-segwit chain where the anyone can spends are sorted by value in each block. but if that was the case, that chain wont be processing normal tx either.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: basically a big giant mess will ensue

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and this would start off the biggest altseason ever seen

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: last one was when BTC was crippled due to mempool backlog and txfee craziness. if BTC splits into such factions, people will scramble to go to altcoins.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you are worried about the anyone can spend, just dont keep your funds in a segwit address starting with 3, addresses starting with 1 are safe

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so would multisig addresses that start with 3, a bit confusing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: personally, i think the odds of such an anyonecan spendcopalypse is pretty low, yet i dont have any BTC in segwit addresses. i never liked segwit

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: Thx for the clarification! How likely do you think "the giant mess" will happen?
